title:Pandapaxxy S23 Seasonal Weapons
description:https://www.reddit.com/r/sharditkeepit/comments/18urnyr/season_23_seasonal_weapons/

// Appentence
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Being a stasis trace rifle already gives Appetence viability in a lot of loadouts. No longer are you tied to Ager’s Scepter for a “kinetic” trace rifle. Appetence is also legendary so you open up a plethora of loadout possibilities. In PvE you can make the most of this trace rifle with Overflow and Killing Tally for a 21% Delirium-lite. Being able to walk over bricks of special to double the magazine capacity keeps Killing Tally primed and ready to rip into any wave of enemy you might have in front of you. If you prefer a more calculated approach or don’t want to use just one weapon, Headstone is extremely strong with the buffed Stasis subclasses." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=4153087276&perks=1840239774,732557052,3643424744,557221067
dimwishlist:item=4153087276&perks=1482024992,732557052,3643424744,557221067

// Appentence
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Taking Appetence into the crucible might be a big test of your patience. Already having low ammo, and the current economy of ammo bricks will severely limit your overall usage. If you can horde ammo bricks like Scrooge you can certainly make this weapon work better. Enlightened Action will make the weapon feel better, and Headstone can deny revives or build into the Stasis subclass like in PvE. Killing Tally can work if you use nothing but this trace rifle but I wouldn’t advise it." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Imperative
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Most of us already have. Workhorse PvE scout. If this is your first season playing destiny either as a new light or a returning player, Imperative has one great redeeming factor; damage. Imperative belongs to the high-impact archetype of scouts giving it the slowest firing rate but the highest damage. Pairing that with more damage through Adrenaline Junkie, some AoE damage through Kinetic Tremors or Explosive Payload. All of these will be happily paired with Rapid Hit for the bonuses to the low stability and reload speed. Subsistence and Keep Away both mitigate the low reload speed by bypassing reload entirely or speeding it up, respectively. I’d still recommend Rapid Hit over both as missing a shot is extremely unforgiving with the slower rate of fire. Precision hits are going to be the goal, why not make follow up shot easier while we’re at it." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=2045811635&perks=839105230,106909392,247725512,3038247973

dimwishlist:item=2045811635&perks=1482024992,3230963543,3619207468,11612903


// Imperative
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Most of us already have. Workhorse PvE scout. If this is your first season playing destiny either as a new light or a returning player, Imperative has one great redeeming factor; damage. Imperative belongs to the high-impact archetype of scouts giving it the slowest firing rate but the highest damage. Pairing that with more damage through Adrenaline Junkie, some AoE damage through Kinetic Tremors or Explosive Payload. All of these will be happily paired with Rapid Hit for the bonuses to the low stability and reload speed. Subsistence and Keep Away both mitigate the low reload speed by bypassing reload entirely or speeding it up, respectively. I’d still recommend Rapid Hit over both as missing a shot is extremely unforgiving with the slower rate of fire. Precision hits are going to be the goal, why not make follow up shot easier while we’re at it." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pvp,controller
dimwishlist:item=2045811635&perks=1840239774,3177308360,3619207468,47981717

// Imperative
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Most of us already have. Workhorse PvE scout. If this is your first season playing destiny either as a new light or a returning player, Imperative has one great redeeming factor; damage. Imperative belongs to the high-impact archetype of scouts giving it the slowest firing rate but the highest damage. Pairing that with more damage through Adrenaline Junkie, some AoE damage through Kinetic Tremors or Explosive Payload. All of these will be happily paired with Rapid Hit for the bonuses to the low stability and reload speed. Subsistence and Keep Away both mitigate the low reload speed by bypassing reload entirely or speeding it up, respectively. I’d still recommend Rapid Hit over both as missing a shot is extremely unforgiving with the slower rate of fire. Precision hits are going to be the goal, why not make follow up shot easier while we’re at it." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:pvp,mkb

// Scatter Signal
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Oh hey, a new strand fusion rifle. Will Scatter Signal be better than Pressurized Precision? Well neither are great as Strand fusion rifles. But for a “Kinetic” fusion rifle I think Scatter Signal rivals and possibly beats out Riptide for best in slot fusion. Overflow and Controlled Burst for added damage throughout the magazine. You’ll only need one magazine booster to hit the fusion cap of 8 shots or you can opt for an even faster firing fusion with Accelerated Coils. Overflow will double your magazine capacity giving you 16 shots, 15 of which will have an extra 20% damage increase. If you opt for Extended Battery for the 16 total shots you can slot in Major or Boss spec for an additional 7.77% damage to every shot." Recommended MW: Charge Time.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=2558925366&perks=839105230,689005463,3643424744,2594592626

// Scatter Signal
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "In PvP there’s not a lot that can convince me that rapid-fire frame fusion rifles are anything other than anti-shotgun weapons. The “Uno Reverse” of the Destiny weapons. Scatter Signal doesn’t really lean into the anti-ape role but it does have a few tricks up its metaphorical sleeve in Kickstart for the most ape fusion we can get. Lower the charge time as low as it can go or just throw on Kickstart for extra damage and speedier shots. I’d pair that with Perpetual Motion for the bonuses to stability and handling. This way the rest of your perks can be invested into range." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=2558925366&perks=3250034553,2969185026,1428297954,1754714824

// Supercluster
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Does Heritage have some competition? I love to see it. Reconstruction on a non-raid weapon paired with Vorpal Weapon for consistent damage throughout the larger mag is going to be your go-to. Enhanced Cascade Point could be funny. I love it on my Until It’s Return as a mini-Fourth Horseman. Oh wow, we are like 3 layers deep. Personally I’d take Assault Mag for the boost to RPM in getting out those shots faster, but it’s not necessary." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Supercluster
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Slug shotguns are not nearly as dominant as they used to be. They used to be a high skill, high reward weapon that prioritized good aim for in return a deep OHK. Threat Detector and Fragile Focus both boost your already good range and handling. That’s really all you’re going to need. Invest the rest of your stats into whatever you feel like you’ll need more. Handling outside of Threat Detector range or range for when your shields are broken." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=92459755&perks=3250034553,3142289711,4071163871,2451262963
dimwishlist:item=92459755&perks=1482024992,3142289711,4071163871,2451262963
dimwishlist:item=92459755&perks=1840239774,3142289711,4071163871,2451262963
dimwishlist:item=92459755&perks=3250034553,791862061,4071163871,2451262963
dimwishlist:item=92459755&perks=1482024992,791862061,4071163871,2451262963
dimwishlist:item=92459755&perks=1840239774,791862061,4071163871,2451262963
dimwishlist:item=92459755&perks=3250034553,3142289711,3161816588,2451262963
dimwishlist:item=92459755&perks=1482024992,3142289711,3161816588,2451262963

dimwishlist:item=92459755&perks=3250034553,791862061,3161816588,2451262963

dimwishlist:item=92459755&perks=1840239774,791862061,3161816588,2451262963


// Adhortative
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Adhortative is an adaptive solar pulse rifle most similar to Forge’s Pledge. Adhortative has better range, handling, and recoil direction, while losing in stability, reload speed and airborne effectiveness. Either pulse is only better than the other by less than 3 points in each category, except for airborne effectiveness and recoil direction, 9 and 10 respectively. Between these two for PvE, Adhortative wins purely for having a reload perk in Feeding Frenzy. If you don’t care about that, either can work." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Adhortative
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "With such a similar pulse existing in PvP it comes down to perks. Forge’s Pledge gets access to Accurized and Steady Rounds, while Adhortative comes with High-Caliber and Ricochet Rounds. Forge’s Pledge comes with Zen Moment and Elemental Capacitor for big bonuses in stats, while Adhortative has Headseeker or Incandescent for better neutrality or some AoE. Depending on your preferred play style you might prefer one over the other, but I cannot emphasize this enough: both can work wonders." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pvp,controller
dimwishlist:item=2993554824&perks=839105230,1885400500,2779035018,460017080

Forge’s Pledge comes with Zen Moment and Elemental Capacitor for big bonuses in stats, while Adhortative has Headseeker or Incandescent for better neutrality or some AoE. // Lethophobia
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Lethophobia is defined as an abnormal anxiety of forgetting. Let’s hope you don’t forget the god rolls of this bow then. As with most PvE bows you’re looking for a good combination of draw time and accuracy. Successful Warm-Up gives you a better draw time post-defeat, but has a bit less utility against higher health enemies. Explosive Head can stagger those arrow sponges a bit easier but having Rapid Hit or Archer’s Tempo there would have been preferred. Disruption break will work best in conjunction with a high damage kinetic weapon like this season's Supercluster slug shotgun. Golden Tricorn will feel great on a combination of subclasses this season with Permeability changing this weapons damage type from void to your selected subclass. You can run a full void or full strand or stasis loadout without much thought. Just remember that the damage change goes away when you stow this weapon." Recommended MW: Draw Time.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=3710082365&perks=852209214,3429800428,2652708987,3365897133
dimwishlist:item=3710082365&perks=1196733167,3429800428,2652708987,3365897133

// Lethophobia
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): " Lethophobia is already making a strong impression on crucible players everywhere being the first bow to roll Disruption Break. Paired with any kinetic weapon you can city shot and get a whopping 50% extra damage on any kinetic weapon from you or anyone on your team. This damage debuff stays applied for a full 5.5 seconds. Be on the lookout for the “Disrupted” debuff off your screen, you will be extra vulnerable for this time." Recommended MW: Accuracy.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Optative
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Precision frame hand cannons have not had their time in the spotlight for a while. Outside of the Seventh Seraph Officer’s Revolver paired with Lucky Pants there are not many reasons to use a precision frame hand cannon. If you run void subclasses a lot you can take advantage of Golden Tricorn to maximize damage, making these fast firing hand cannons feel way more chunky than they normally are. Rapid Hit will also bring up the already decent reload speed and their exceptional stability. If you feel like you need more range in PvE (which is an already odd thing to task for) you can opt for Keep Away for a continuous reload speed buff and a touch more range." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Optative
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Keep Away is stronger in the crucible where range matters far more. Kill Clip gives you nostalgia for the Not Forgotten or Luna’s Howl days of yore with a 0.67 time to kill. You are put in a time constraint which some players might not like, but in 6v6 game modes it’s not too hard to find another unwilling participant. Fully invested into range your Optative can reach out to 34.66 meters, for the record that is further by over 1 meter than catalyzed Thorn. The drawback is the lower 1.0 s TtK but once you get going with the 0.67 TtK you can destroy any Thorn user. (Food for thought)." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,controller
dimwishlist:item=2817683783&perks=1840239774,3142289711,3619207468,1015611457

//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Keep Away is stronger in the crucible where range matters far more. Kill Clip gives you nostalgia for the Not Forgotten or Luna’s Howl days of yore with a 0.67 time to kill. You are put in a time constraint which some players might not like, but in 6v6 game modes it’s not too hard to find another unwilling participant. Fully invested into range your Optative can reach out to 34.66 meters, for the record that is further by over 1 meter than catalyzed Thorn. The drawback is the lower 1.0 s TtK but once you get going with the 0.67 TtK you can destroy any Thorn user. (Food for thought)." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb

// Scalar Potential
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "I hope that Scalar Potential lives up to its name. An arc rapid-fire frame Feels. Very. Familiar. Huh, I can’t place my thumb on it. Well, since we’ve never seen one of these before you’re going to want Overflow to double your magazine capacity, and Golden Tricorn to really pump up that damage. Arrowhead Brake is almost required for the low 53 recoil direction. With our new deterministic recoil you might be able to learn the recoil pattern and not need Arrowhead Brake, but I don’t like to fight with my weapons." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Scalar Potential
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Scalar Potential doesn’t reinvent the wheel. The perks unique to it aren’t useful in the crucible spare Enlightened Action which will make this pulse feel better but not help its lethality. Neutrally with Headseeker you could have a pulse that feels fantastic, but Keep Away will probably be better for the range and accuracy bonuses. If you like the model and sights I’d suggest grinding out the patterns, if you already have another rapid-fire frame pulse I wouldn’t worry too much about this one." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pvp,controller
dimwishlist:item=2563668388&perks=839105230,3142289711,3619207468,460017080

// Scalar Potential
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Scalar Potential doesn’t reinvent the wheel. The perks unique to it aren’t useful in the crucible spare Enlightened Action which will make this pulse feel better but not help its lethality. Neutrally with Headseeker you could have a pulse that feels fantastic, but Keep Away will probably be better for the range and accuracy bonuses. If you like the model and sights I’d suggest grinding out the patterns, if you already have another rapid-fire frame pulse I wouldn’t worry too much about this one." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb
dimwishlist:item=2563668388&perks=839105230,3142289711,3619207468,460017080

dimwishlist:item=2563668388&perks=3250034553,3142289711,3643424744,2610012052


// Subjunctive
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Subjunctive was the smg that could. It felt great in PvE and held its own back when recluse dominated all aspects of our life. Oh how naive we were. When Rampage and Outlaw were all we cared about. Things have shifted and more weapons are certainly popular. The only true competition Subjunctive needs to worry about is the Ikelos SMG. Both are arc, but what gives Subjunctive the edge? Golden Tricorn. It’s not the highest uptime on Arc but you can chain back to back arc ability kills with some loadouts, this will give Subjunctive a 1.5x damage bonus over the Ikelos (this is without giving the Ikelos a damage perk of its own). Most players spec’ed into Voltshot which will clear rooms easier but have slight difficulties taking down beefier targets. With Golden Tricorn 2x you’ll have enough damage to look at enemies and they’ll become unalive from sheer admiration, and you’ll be able to chunk down majors with ease, Subsistence just keeps the chains rolling." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=1447836603&perks=1482024992,1087426260,1820235745,2610012052

//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Subjunctive in PvP is a bit more subjective. Being a lightweight frame without any large range extending perks puts Subjunctive lower on the list of best SMGs within Shadx’s playhouse. Threat detector helps boost your stats within range, and Swashbuckler can help your next engagement when you ultimately melee your opponent dead." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,controller

// Doomed Petitioner
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "We have ourselves the second craftable non-raid aggressive frame linear fusion rifle. Holy traveler. Say that sentence 5 times fast. I think Doomed Petitioner will be slightly more used over Fire and Forget due to a reload bypassing perk in Reconstruction. Pair that with either Golden Tricorn on void or Precision Instrument to really crank up those stacks within two shots. Envious Assassin works well if you’re slaying enemies before your damage phase while Reconstruction works well passively." Recommended MW: Charge Time.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Doomed Petitioner
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "I adore these fusions for PvP, they just feel nice. Unfortunately they’re only slightly outclassed by grenade launchers in our current meta and swords are way more mobile. This doesn’t leave a lot of room for them to shine. Keep Away and Moving Target will buff your accuracy and aim assist while also giving a nice bonus to range and movement, respectfully. You’ll want to lower the charge time as low as you can and the origin trait will also help with that." Recommended MW: Charge Time.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller
